metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3779 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description: active-support ruby gem 5.2.0 could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by containing a malicious backdoor. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> In Oneiric-Saucy, rails package is just for transition; The rails package contains actual code from vivid onward msalvatore> Based on the hackerone report, a fake gem named "active-support" was released to trick people into downloading the malicious "active-support" gen instead of the official "activesupport" gem.

criterions.comment: rails-4.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ruby-actionpack-3.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ruby-activemodel-3.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ruby-activerecord-3.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ruby-activesupport-3.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ruby-rails-3.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
